model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Coach, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Athlete: Ted Athlete unrolls the map. He looks at it for a few moments before tracing his finger along one of the highways. "This is our route," he says finally, feeling in control.

[MEMORY]
1. The Athlete is focused on helping the team succeed and has shown leadership qualities during warm-ups and stretches, which leads to the Athlete deciding to tough it out and stay focused on the game.
2. The Coach is giving advice to the Athlete regarding their performance and focus, causing the coach to encourage the athlete to continue their good work with nutrition and training, which results in the Coach encouraging the Athlete to keep up the good work and acknowledges their achievements, leading to the Athlete taking on more responsibilities and gaining respect from other players.
3. The Athlete decides to tough it out and stay focused on the game, which changes to the Athlete being focused on improving their performance and energy levels, causing the Athlete to take on more responsibilities and gain respect from other players.
